means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 博恩绰号，来源于古法语，含义是“好”(good)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 博恩绰号，骨瘦如柴者，来源于古英语，含义是“骨头”(bone)

word_mean: 骨：质地坚硬的结缔组织，绝大多数脊椎动物的骨骼主要由骨组织组成。骨组织由有机成分(细胞和基质)和无机(矿物)成分构成
基质内有胶原纤维支架，其间嵌入矿物成分
矿物成分以磷酸钙(占85％)和碳酸钙(占10％)为主，使骨组织质地坚硬。又称osseous ｔissue
躯体骨架或单独骨块，又称os
骨，奇恒之腑之一，为人身的支架，由筋肉连接，有支撑形体、保护内脏和进行运动的功能。

sentence.Network_en: A vicious price war between manufacturers has cut margins to the bone.
sentence.Network_cn: 制造商之间的恶性价格战已将利润削减到了最低。

sentence.Network_en: Our bone marrow contains fat in the form of small globules.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的骨髓中含有小球状的脂肪。

sentence.Network_en: The bullet lodged in the sergeant's leg, shattering his thigh bone.
sentence.Network_cn: 子弹嵌进了中士的腿里，使其股骨碎裂。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a remark) penetrating and accurate to the point of causing hurt or discomfort

phrase.cizu_name: cut (或 pare) something to the bone

jx.jx_en_mean: reduce something to the bare minimum

lj.lj_ly: costs will have to be cut to the bone.
lj.lj_ls: 成本必须降到最低程度。

phrase.cizu_name: have a bone to pick with someone

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)have reason to disagree or be annoyed with someone
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)同…有争端要解决，对…有理由怀恨

jx.jx_en_mean: felt, understood, believed, or known very deeply or instinctively
jx.jx_cn_mean: 深深地（或本能地）感到，理解，相信，知道

lj.lj_ly: something good was bound to happen; he could feel in his bones.
lj.lj_ls: 他本能地觉得一定会有好事发生。

jx.jx_en_mean: have no hesitation in stating or dealing with (something), however unpleasant, awkward, or distasteful it is
jx.jx_cn_mean: 对…毫不犹豫，对…直言不讳

lj.lj_ly: he makes no bones about his feelings towards the militants.
lj.lj_ls: 他直言不讳地说出了自己对激进分子们的态度。

phrase.cizu_name: not have a —— bone in one's body

jx.jx_en_mean: have not the slightest trace of the specified quality

lj.lj_ly: she hasn't got a sympathetic bone in her body.

jx.jx_en_mean: (of meat or fish) having had the bone or bones removed before being cooked, served, or sold
(of meat or fish) having the bone or bones left in when cooked, served, or sold
(Austral.)(of an Aboriginal) cast a spell on (someone) so as to cause their sickness or death
jx.jx_cn_mean: (澳大利亚)（土著）以凶符骨指向…咒其倒霉（或丧命）

jx.jx_en_mean: (S. African)use divining bones to foretell the future or discover the source of a difficulty by studying the pattern they form when thrown on the ground
(of a wound) so deep as expose a person's bone

lj.lj_ly: his thigh had been axed open to the bone.
lj.lj_ls: 他的大腿被斧头砍伤及骨头。

lj.lj_ly: his contempt cut her to the bone.
lj.lj_ls: 他的轻视对她伤害极深。

phrase.cizu_name: to one's bones (或 to the bone)

jx.jx_en_mean: used to emphasize that a person has a specified quality or experience in an overwhelming or very fundamental way
jx.jx_cn_mean: 深入骨髓，彻底地，到极点

lj.lj_ly: he's a cop to the bone.
lj.lj_ls: 他是个地地道道的警察。

phrase.cizu_name: what's bred in the bone will come out in the flesh

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)a person's behaviour or characteristics are determined by their heredity

phrase.cizu_name: work one's fingers to the bone

jx.jx_cn_mean: 不住手地工作；勤奋工作

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bán, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch been and German Bein

encyclopedia.content: BONE公司简介 BONE（果铺创意）由台湾土生土长的设计师林进升自创的品牌。2005年由公司的执行长兼设计总监林进升一人创立公司开始，在工作及生活的体验找到灵感，由灵感转变为设计，再让设计量产为商品，变成一个企业，形成一个品牌行销全球，树立设计师创业的典范，由设计开始的成功企业证明了设计的价值。目前在全球有5000多个销售据点，遍及日本、美洲、北欧、西欧等地，商品推展成绩非常亮眼。 BONE小企鹅 林进升创业经历 200

entry.def: Your bones are the hard parts inside your body which together form your skeleton.
If you bone a piece of meat or fish, you remove the bones from it before cooking it.

example.ex: Make sure that you do not pierce the skin when boning the chicken thighs...
example.tran: 剔鸡腿骨时切勿戳破外面的皮。

example.ex: The boned fish is so easy to serve.
example.tran: 剔了刺的鱼很容易烹制。

entry.def: A bone tool or ornament is made of bone.

example.ex: ...a small, expensive pocketknife with a bone handle.

entry.def: The bare bones of something are its most basic parts or details.

example.ex: There are not even the bare bones of a garden here — I've got nothing.
example.tran: 这儿连个花园的影子都没有——我什么也没看到。

entry.tran: 太过直白；过于直率；露骨
entry.def: If something is too close to the bone, it makes you feel uncomfortable because it is very close to the truth or to the real nature of something.
If you say that you feel or know something in your bones, you are indicating that you are certain about it, although you cannot explain why.

example.ex: I've got a feeling in my bones that things are not quite right.
example.tran: 直觉告诉我情况不太对头。

entry.def: If you make no bones about something, you talk openly about it, rather than trying to keep it a secret.

example.ex: Some of them make no bones about their political views.
example.tran: 他们中的一些人坦率地表达了自己的政治观点。

entry.tran: 毫不犹豫；毫不迟疑；二话不说
entry.def: If you make no bones about doing something that is unpleasant or difficult or that might upset someone else, you do it without hesitating.

example.ex: Stafford-Clark made no bones about reapplying for the job when Daldry was standing for it.
example.tran: 当戴德利对他表示支持时，斯塔福德-克拉克毫不迟疑地再次申请了这份工作。

entry.tran: 瘦得皮包骨头；瘦骨嶙峋
entry.def: You can say someone is just skin and bone when you do not approve of the fact that they are very thin.

example.ex: He was nothing but skin and bones.
example.tran: 他瘦得只剩皮包骨头了。

entry.tran: （削减）达到最低限度，到最小化
entry.def: If something such as costs are cut to the bone, they are reduced to the minimum possible.

example.ex: It has survived by cutting its costs to the bone...
example.tran: 它通过最大限度地降低运营成本生存了下来。

example.ex: Profit margins have been slashed to the bone in an attempt to keep turnover moving.
example.tran: 为了维持资金周转，利润率已被降为最低。

entry.def: You use to the bone to indicate that you are very deeply affected by something. For example, if you feel chilled to the bone, your whole body feels extremely cold, often because you have had a shock.

example.ex: What I saw chilled me to the bone.
example.tran: 我看到的景象令我不寒而栗。

means.word_mean: 1. rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates
2. the porous calcified substance from which bones are made
3. a shade of white the color of bleached bones
1. study intensively, as before an exam;

sentences.sentence: "I had to bone up on my Latin verbs before the final exam"

means.word_mean: 1. consisting of or made up of bone;

slang.tokens: have a bone to pick with

list.explanation: 同…有争端'对…有理由怀恨，抱怨(某人或某嚷物)

example.en: They had a bone to pick with neighbouring villages.
example.zh: 他们与邻村曾布过争端端。

example.en: The ambassador had a bone to pick with the student demonstrations.
example.zh: 大使就学生示威一事提出抗议。

auth_sentence.res_content: The bone fragments are much lighter than the stones.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The bone fragments are much lighter than the stones.

auth_sentence.res_content: Bone was also alleged to have his genitals exposed.

Sentence.sentence: She walked to the local grocery store to buy broken biscuits which were much cheaper, and to get a free bone for her much loved dog.
Its purpose is to build and maintain bone and muscle mass, both of which shrink with age.

sentences.en: The dog was chewing a bone.
Buttons are sometimes made of bone.
sentences.cn: 纽扣有时是用骨头做的。

sentences.en: Her bones were laid to rest.

jushi.english: Don't try to eat the fish bone.
The system was built on the dead bones of the pioneers.
jushi.chinese: 这个制度是建筑在先驱者累累白骨之上的。
